AVSEC Order No.9/2011 
Subject : Special security measures requested by state. 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification         
No. 1797, dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil 
Aviation, for the purpose of securing the aircraft operations and access  control at the  
civil  airports in India directs that: 
 
(i)      Special security measures requested by a State  in respect of   their aircraft 
operator  operating to/ from India shall, to the extent practicable, be carried 
out.  
 
(ii)   
In order that such requests for special security receive appropriate attention  
of   the  BCAS  the  concerned States should, after mutual consultations and 
prior to any special requests, define procedures and identify officials at the 
government, airport and aircraft operator levels to be notified of or to receive 
threat information.  
 
 
(iii)  
All  such requests   shall    be  sent   to the  Commissioner  through  the   
concerned  Regional Dy Commissioner of  Security (CA), BCAS.  
 
(iv)   
If  considered necessary   by the   Commissioner,   the   matter   before   
acceding to   any   such  request  for  special  security measures,  the issue    
may  be  deliberated    at the  BCAS  Hqrs. by the   Joint  or Adl.  
Commissioner of  Security  (CA)  with the  representatives  of the  concerned  
State  facing   any threat  and  appropriate  action  to  enforce  special  
security measures  within the  ambit of the  NCASP  shall   be  directed   by 
the   BCAS. 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS) 
Commissioner of Security  (CA )
